intro: Anil leucoclada, commonly known as the white-flowered anil, is a species native to the Mediterranean region. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family, known for its delicate, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. Anil leucoclada is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, aromatic scent.
